---
title: "WakeApp: SleSI"
---

Data analysis of WakeApp cognitive testing from the Sleep and Social Interaction (SleSI) study

Some of these effects require careful thinking over. They are very complex.

Some models have some convergence problems, but nothing too bad.

[I think this is worthwhile reading regarding quadratic and cubic effects in longitudinal data](https://books.google.se/books?id=8jxyBgAAQBAJ&pg=PA257&lpg=PA257&dq=what+is+the+quadratic+effect+when+there+is+a+cubic+effect&source=bl&ots=ifluRVXJeQ&sig=GJfGe7XQ-6DKjDt-T425NVNp1gY&hl=sv&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi1rPWP2rjWAhUkQJoKHfOtClEQ6AEIbDAJ#v=onepage&q=what%20is%20the%20quadratic%20effect%20when%20there%20is%20a%20cubic%20effect&f=false)
